summary: Leodis C. Matthews was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). His name appears on multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from April 1978 to January 1979. These documents list his name, social security number, position, salary, and employment dates within the SCA. The consistent appearance of his name across these reports indicates his employment with the committee during this period.
significance: Leodis C. Matthews' significance lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating his involvement in the investigation of the JFK assassination, although the specific nature and extent of his role are not detailed in these documents.
